text: Sets a scaling factor for how much influence the angle of incidence of light on a surface has on the brightness of the surface. n must be between 0.0 and 1.0. Smaller values mean less attenuation, with zero meaning that angle of incidence has no effect at all on the brightness.
Color of the light entity.

Split up the light into a sphere of randomly positioned lights within radius 'n' (in world units). Useful to give shadows a wider penumbra. '_samples' specifies the number of lights in the sphere. The 'light' value is automatically scaled down for most lighting formulas (except linear and non-additive minlight) to attempt to keep the brightness equal.
Overrides dirt mapping choice from compiler.
Overrides dirt mapping choice from worldspawn for this particular light. -1 Forces off; 0 = Worldspawn decides; 1 = Forces on.
Overrides the global '_dirtscale' or '_dirtgain' settings to change how this light is affected by dirtmapping (ambient occlusion).

Bitflag that specifies which channels should be projected in the lighting. 0 = legacy behavior. Formula for every bitflag is 2^(X-1), so for channels 4, 13 and 20, it would be 2^(4-1)+2^(13-1)+2^(20-1) = 2^3+2^12+2^19 = 8+4096+524288 = 528392.
Color taken by minlight.
Minimum light for all surfaces.
Textures to exclude from minlighting.
If checked, allows the use of double-sided faces.

Bitflag that specifies which channels should undergo transparency. 0 = legacy behavior. Formula for every bitflag is 2^(X-1), so for channels 4, 13 and 20, it would be 2^(4-1)+2^(13-1)+2^(20-1) = 2^3+2^12+2^19 = 8+4096+524288 = 528392.
If checked, enables phong shading in the brush.
If Phong Shading is enabled, specifies the lighting angle.
Specifies an angle for texture projection.
Specifies lighting projection for the texture.
Specifies which texture should be projected.
Number of lights to use for '_deviance'. Only used if '_deviance' is set.
If checked, the entity casts a shadow.

Bitflag that specifies which channels should cast a shadow in the lighting. 0 = legacy behavior. Formula for every bitflag is 2^(X-1), so for channels 4, 13 and 20, it would be 2^(4-1)+2^(13-1)+2^(20-1) = 2^3+2^12+2^19 = 8+4096+524288 = 528392.
If checked, casts a shadow over itself.

Specifies the angle in degrees for an inner spotlight cone (must be less than the 'angle' cone. Creates a softer transition between the full brightness of the inner cone to the edge of the outer cone.

Makes surfaces with the given texture name emit light, by using this light as a template which is copied across those surfaces. Lights are spaced about 128 units (though possibly closer due to bsp splitting) apart and positioned 2 units above the surfaces
Controls the offset lights are placed above surfaces for '_surface'.
Is this surface light a spotlight? If so, orient it so it points away from the surface normal. 0 = No; 1 = Yes.
After activation, it accelerates at this rate. Its top speed is mentioned in speed.
If the accel flag is checked, after activation, it accelerates at this rate. Its top speed is mentioned in speed.
Determines raising speed based on the lowest player's distance. It's the divisor.
Sets the transparency of the blackhole.
Sets the transparency of the lobotomized soldier.
Sets the transparency of the monster.
Amount of ammo this weapon gives on pickup.
Facing angle of the entity (Yaw).
Facing angle of the text (Yaw 0-360). -3 = Tracks player; -2 = Down; -1 = Up.
Specifies the angle in degrees for a spotlight cone.
Facing angles of the entity (Pitch Yaw Roll).
End frame of alternate animation.
If checked, alternate frames are clamped rather than wrapped.
Alternate animation speed in milliseconds.
Starting frame of alternate animation.
0 = Forwards; 1 = Backwards; 2 = Random
End frame of animation.
If checked, frames are clamped rather than wrapped.
Animation speed in milliseconds.
Starting frame of animation.
0 = Forwards; 1 = Backwards; 2 = Random
Clock counter.
The position of this character in the overall target_string string.
Overall duration of the earthquake.
After activation, it desacelerates at this rate. Starts from the top speed and goes down to 0.
If the accel flag is checked, after activation, it desacelerates at this rate. Starts from the top speed and goes down to 0.
Target delay time.
Delay time between sparks.
Attenuation formula for this light entity. 0 = Linear falloff; 1 = Inv. distance falloff; 2 = Inv. distance squared; 3 = No falloff; 4 = Local minlight; 5 = Inv. distance 2
After the boss is killed, the bar spends this amount of time on screen before disappearing.
Laser Delay.
Rotation in degrees of the door.
Gesture To Use When Triggered. 0 = FlipOff, 1 = Salute, 2 = Taunt, 3 = Wave, 4 = Point.
Amount of damage the door takes when blocked.
When exploding, deals this amount of damage on its radius.
Deals this amount of damage when it crushes another entity (mostly players).
Deals this amount of damage on explosion.
Deals this amount of damage per blast.
Deals this amount of damage over time as long as the target is touched by the laser.
Values X Y Z, signals the offset from the origin brush's center of the camera where the eye is located.
Distance in units that fade ends, should be greater than fade_start_dist.
Distance in units that fade begins, should be smaller than fade_end_dist.
Name of .md2 player weapon model to hold. Example: 'w_hyperblaster'
Amount of damage this button takes before being triggered.
Amount of damage this door takes before being triggered.
Amount of damage this entity takes before exploding.
Movement distance of the platform.
Type of model to use. 1 = Female, 2 = Male, 3 = Cyborg
Path to custom flare image to use instead of the default one.
Path to custom PCX skin image to use instead of the default one. Example: venus.
Target to fully delete.
Target to be angry at.
Brightness intensity of this light entity. Positive values: brighter lighting. Negative values: subtracts lighting from surrounding entities.
Lip remaining after move.

Turns the light into a spotlight and specifies the direction of light using yaw(x), pitch(y) and roll(z) in degrees. Yaw specifies the angle around the Z-axis from 0 to 359 degrees and pitch specifies the angle from 90 (straight up) to -90 (straight down). Roll has no effect, so use any value (e.g. 0). Often easier than the 'target' method.
The next map to load. See Notes.
When exploding, leaves this amount of debris all around.
Displays this message when this entity is triggered.
Displays this message when this item is picked up.
The name of the boss displayed in the health bar.
Displays this message when triggered.
Starting/ending light level. See Notes.
Points to invest in monster reinforcements. Increases up to 2x on Hard skill.
Sound to play when the entity is finished.
Sound that play while the entity is traveling.
Sound to play when the entity is active.
Sound to play when the entity is started.
When the entity is triggered, this target is triggered too.
Automatically sets the eye position. Point this towards an info_notnull which gets freed after spawn.
Target to fire when we reach a point.
Additional delay for START_ON timers.
How much ammo this box will give.
Detection Radius for players.
Specifies the size of the text.
Scale multiplier of the flare.
Specifies the scale of the model.
Waiting time variance (+/-). Must be equal or less than the value in wait.
Semicolon separated list of entity classes and cost of monster to spawn. (i.e. monster_flyer 1; monster_kamikaze 1)
Flare Color (Red Green Blue Alpha; each value falls inside the range [0-255]).
Laser Color (Red Green Blue Alpha; each value falls inside the range [0-255]).
Sets the scale of the blackhole.
Sets the scale of the lobotomized soldier.
Sets the scale of the monster.
Sets the outer cone angle if this light is a spot light.
Distance in world units (from player's view position) in which the light is fully faded out and not rendered.
Intensity scalar for the light.
Sets the radius of a dynamic shadow light. Becomes a dynamic light if this is bigger than 0.
Shadow map resolution; leave blank to automatically determine from radius.
The distance in world units (from player's view position) in which fading begins.
Appearance of the dynamic light. See Notes.
Light entity to pick up style ID from.
If checked, silences the entity.
Specifies the sound the water emits. 0 = Silent; 1 = Water 1; 2 = Water 2.
0 = White; 1 = Red; 2 = Blue; 3 = Green; 4 = Yellow; 5 = Black; 6 = Cyan; 7 = Orange.
CD Track Number.
Specifies how fast the button is pressed.
Specifies how fast the door is opened.
Determines how fast we should move on each axis in order to reach the target.
Specifies how fast the platform should move.
How fast should the viper crash into the world.
How fast the ship should move from its starting position.
How fast the blaster should shoot.
How fast the camera should move.
How severe the earthquake should be.
Speed of light.
0 = xx; 1 = xx:xx; 2 = xx:xx:xx
Hue of the force wall.

Defines the lighting style. 0 = Normal; 1 = Flicker #1; 2 = Slow Strong Pulse; 3 = Candle #1; 4 = Fast Strobe; 5 = Gentle Pulse #1; 6 = Flicker #2; 7 = Candle #2; 8 = Candle #3; 9 = Slow Strobe; 10 = Fluorescent Flicker; 11 = Slow pulse, no black.
When picked up, activates this target.
The targetname of the first path_corner where the train activates.
Target to make angered.
The targetname of the info_landmark to pinpoint this entity to.
The targetname of the monster that acts as the boss.
Name of the entity for events.
Points to a spawnpoint matching the previous level's target_changelevel.
For teamed doors, this is the name that binds them.
For teamed brushes in this entity, this is the name that binds them.
For teamed brushes in a train, this is the name that binds them.
Teams this water brush with another entity that triggers it.
For teamed items, this is the name that teams them.
The team this character is linked to.
Determines how wide the vision cone should be.
Waiting time before the button is resetted.
Waiting time before the door is resetted.
Waiting time after losing the target before returning to a neutral angle.
Base Waiting time. Can be combined with random for differing variations.
Waiting time before water returns to its initial state.
Waiting time before this path can be taken.
Value that scales the fade distance of this light entity. Values larger than 1 make the light fade more quickly. Values lesser than 1 make the light fade slower and reach further.
Waitilg time of the laser.
